channel.title: Lifehacker
channel.description: Tips and downloads for getting things done
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Too Much Planning is Indistinguishable From Procrastination
item.description:
Procrastinating feels lazy. You know you shouldn't, but you do it anyway because work is hard. Planning, brainstorming, and discussing feels productive because you're talking about doing stuff. If you don't move to action, though, there's no difference between the two.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: A Basic Guide to the Different Types of Bank Accounts
item.description:
Most of us having a checking and savings accountâ€”that's pretty standard. But there are a handful of other kinds of accounts offered by banks and credit unions. We thought we'd put together a primer on the basic types of accounts, so you can see which ones might work for you.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wong on Two Cents, shared by Andy Orin to Lifehacker

item.title: Humble Bundle App Now Manages Audio, Ebook Downloads
item.description:
Android: The Humble Bundles have always been a great way to score sweet games, books, audiobooks and soundtracks. Now, with the latest app update, you can download all of it directly to your Android phone.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Typ.io Recommends Matching Fonts for Better Design
item.description:
Web: Whether you're designing a website or making your resume look better, the right fonts can take it to a new level. Typ.io makes it easy to learn which fonts complement each other. But it's difficult to know which fonts complement each other. Typ.io wants to make that easy.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: Get More Out of Your Drill With These Tips and Attachments
item.description:
A cordless drill is a handy tool to have around, but it can do a lot more than drill holes. Here are some interesting attachments that go beyond your typical set of bits.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Kit Stansley on Workshop, shared by Andy Orin to Lifehacker

item.title: What's The Best Rewards Credit Card?
item.description:
Not all credit cards are alike. Some offer low interest rates, some have no fees, but others offer great rewards on travel, cash back, and other perks. This week we want to know which ones you think are the best.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: Avoid Saying "I'm Negotiable" When Talking Salary in an Interview
item.description:
When you are asked what you are expecting as salary, many of us state a number; and when the recruiter is silent, we follow it up with, "But I'm negotiable." It's the worst thing you can do.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mihir Patkar

item.title: The Best Bundles that Save Money on Multiple Purchases
item.description:
Whether you're shopping for books, music, software, or video games, the web is full of "bundles," or discounted packs, where you can get lots of goodies at a discounted price. Let's build a list of the best bundles around the web that offer good stuff at great pricesâ€”whatever that stuff may be.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Alan Henry

item.title: The Organized Dorm Room Workspace
item.description:
College dorms normally don't give you a lot of space to play with, and with tight student budgets, many dorms just end up with a mishmash of furniture haphazardly arranged. Flickr user lorby351's room, however, is different.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: The Question You Should Ask Your Financial Advisor
item.description:
Investing money the right way is a tough code to crackâ€”that's why having a financial advisor is a good idea. Financial advisors probably handle their own investments too, and that's why you should ask them what they do with their money.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: How to Access Facebook Messages on iOS Without Facebook Messenger
item.description:
We've talked about the benefits of Facebook Messenger , but if you're still not convinced, The Guardian shows off a handy little trick to access your messages in the iPhone Facebook app without installing the Messenger app.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Take a Break with These Travel Wallpapers
item.description:
Whatever your ideal type of travel is, these wallpapers can remind you of past trips or help you dream up future ones. Almost all seven continents are represented and ready for you to download.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Heather Yamada-Hosley on Wayfarer, shared by Andy Orin to Lifehacker

item.title: The Pros and Cons of Different Types of Home Flooring
item.description:
If you're looking to renovate a home or taking a look at new places to live, you should know the pros and cons of various flooring types. This visual guide covers nine different flooring types and how they rate when it comes to cost, durability, difficulty of installation, and how easy they are to clean.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Should You Turn Your Hobby into a Business? Five Questions to Ask
item.description:
Sure, you love your favorite after-hours activity now, but will you love it when it's your only source of income? Turning your hobby into a business is a big decision, and you need to ask yourself a few questions before taking the plunge.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jessica Stillman

item.title: The email app Mailbox was updated today with support for 19 new languages, a new spam marking functi
item.description:
The email app Mailbox was updated today with support for 19 new languages, a new spam marking function, Passbook support, and a few other bug fixes. You can grab it right now in the iTunes App Store.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: Clear Your Backlog by Working like You're Going on Vacation
item.description:
Everyone has a backlog of work they need get done at one time or another, but actually getting to it is a pretty daunting task. One way you can help yourself take it on is by imagining you're preparing for vacation and you need to get it done before you leave.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patrick Allan

item.title: Why It's So Hard to Remember People's Names
item.description:
It happens to the best of us. You meet someone at a party, then three days later you run into them at the grocery store and can't remember their name. The Atlantic takes a look at why that is.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: CARROT, the Sadistic To-Do App, Adds Speech, a New Story, and More
item.description:
iPhone: We're fans of CARROT , the to-do app that makes you work for your success by adding a bit of hostility to your to-dos. Today, it adds some new features, including a new speech synthesizer, a new story chapter, and more.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Thorin Klosowski

item.title: What's The Best Electric Razor?
item.description:
Death, taxes, and facial hair. Shaving can be a leisurely, spa-like experience with the right equipment and time, but more often than not it's just an annoying time drain, especially if you're required to do it for work. The electric razor is the most convenient of the shaving utensils, and this week we're going to find out which electric is the best.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shane Roberts, Commerce Team on Kinja Co-Op, shared by Shane Roberts, Commerce Team to Lifehacker

item.title: I'm Mark Arnoldy, CEO of Possible, and This Is How I Work
item.description:
In the hills of rural Nepal, a cow passes by a hospital window as Mark Arnoldy sits down to work. His company Possible is a nonprofit dedicated to bringing affordable healthcare to far-flung places where medical supplies and expertise are an invaluable resource.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Andy Orin

item.title: Remember the "One in the Air Is Two on the Ground" Rule When Flying
item.description:
If you fancy an alcoholic drink or two when you're on a plane, keep in mind that the drinks could affect you more than they would if you were on land.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: Get Free IT Training with Microsoft Virtual Academy
item.description:
Microsoft Virtual Academy offers hundreds of free courses for anyone interested in improving their computer or IT skills.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola

item.title: The Best Features of Facebook Messenger You're Probably Not Using
item.description:
Facebook took a lot of flak for making its standalone Messenger app mandatory. Many feel (myself among them) that a standalone app for messages is unnecessary. Even so, that doesn't make it a bad app, or not useful in its own way . Here are some of the best features of Facebook Messenger that make it worth using.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Eric Ravenscraft

item.title: Deals: Discounted Streaming Boxes, Laptop Stands, Bluetooth Everything
item.description:
We've got a handful of great streaming box deals for you today. The pair of Chromecasts are a great deal if you have two TVs without them, the Fire TV hasn't really been discounted until now, and the $50 price drop on the top-of-the-line Slingbox is great for anyone who wants to watch TV on the road.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister, Commerce Team

item.title: Answer the "What Is Your Salary?" Question with the Amount You Want
item.description:
At some point before or during your job interview, you'll probably be asked how much you're currently making. The Personal Branding Blog offers some suggestions for deflecting this unnecessary question .

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Melanie Pinola
